Neodymium (Nd).use_case: Permanent magnets for motors (servo motors, actuators)
Neodymium (Nd).importance: Critical - all humanoid joints use Nd-based motors

Dysprosium (Dy).use_case: High-temperature permanent magnets (added to Nd magnets)
Dysprosium (Dy).importance: Critical - improves motor efficiency at high temps
Dysprosium (Dy).supply_risk: Very High - most scarce heavy REE

China.notes: Dominant player, controls processing even for foreign-mined REE
China.policy: Export restrictions, domestic subsidies for manufacturing

USA.notes: Mountain Pass mine (MP Materials), but ships to China for processing

Myanmar.notes: Exports primarily to China (illegal mining concerns)

typical_humanoid_robot.notes: Relatively small % of total cost, but supply risk is real

at_scale_production.risk_assessment: Manageable for single company, but if 10 companies scale simultaneously...
at_scale_production.china_dependency: Critical bottleneck - 85% of Nd from China

US_China_Decoupling.scenario: US restricts Chinese robotics imports, China restricts REE exports
US_China_Decoupling.impact: US robotics companies face 2-3x REE costs, potential supply disruption
US_China_Decoupling.mitigation: MP Materials domestic processing, recycling, alternative magnet research

China_Export_Controls.scenario: China imposes export quotas on processed REE (already done for Ga, Ge)
China_Export_Controls.impact: Global REE prices spike 50-100%, favors Chinese manufacturers
China_Export_Controls.mitigation: Limited - takes 5-10 years to build alternative supply chain
China_Export_Controls.precedent: Gallium/Germanium export controls (2023), Magnet export restrictions (2024)

US_Subsidies_Advantage.scenario: IRA + CHIPS Act subsidies accelerate US REE processing
US_Subsidies_Advantage.impact: US robotics companies get domestic supply by 2026-2027

Magnet_Recycling.technology: Urban mining (recycle REE from e-waste, old motors)

Ferrite_Magnets.use_case: Low-cost applications, but not suitable for humanoid joints (need high torque-to-weight)
Ferrite_Magnets.risk: Performance penalty too high for premium robots
